alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 6:07AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Creek and Okfuskee Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 607 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles north of Sparks to 2 miles south of Little to 4 miles northwest of Sasakwa. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Bristow... Okemah... Okfuskee... Boley... Weleetka... Depew... Paden... Bearden... Slick... Castle... Clearview... Welty... Pharoah... Milfay... Mason... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 231. Interstate 44 between mile markers 178 and 180. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
